ReportSection.title: ECR Grants
ReportSection.Static:
PROGRAM DESCRIPTION

AGE-WELL ECR Grants are offered twice per year to eligible participants in the AGE-WELL Early Career Researcher Program. The grants are intended to support participants to build and scale independent research programs in the ‘AGE-WELL way’: emphasizing co-creation, transdisciplinary working, and integrating knowledge mobilization and commercialization as project end goals.

Eligibility

  • Applicants must be participants in the AGE-WELL ECR Program
  • Applicants must hold an EPIC Certificate
  • Applicants must be able to hold Tri-Council funds

Please note that successful recipients are unable to hold more than one AGE-WELL ECR Grant per calendar year.

Eligible Activities

To be considered for funding, proposals must clearly align to one of AGE-WELL’s Challenge Areas and demonstrate network values including transdisciplinarity and co-creation in order to accelerate the delivery of technology-based solutions that make a meaningful difference in the lives of older Canadians.

Eligible activities include those which:

  1. support the inclusion of older adults and caregivers in your research and/or teaching
  2. support knowledge mobilization or commercialization activities
  3. fund small scale research or pilot projects to enable larger research grant applications

Funds Available

AGE-WELL ECR Grants are up to $7500 over 6 months. Applicants should review the Use of Grant Funds section of the Tri-Agency (CIHR, NSERC and SSHRC) Financial Administration Guide for a complete listing and description of allowable costs and activities.

Application Review Criteria

The following criteria and scoring scheme are used to evaluate the applications:

Objectives & Rationale 25%
  • the activity or project’s relevance to AGE-WELL values and mission
  • the activity or project reflects the ‘AGE-WELL Way’
  • originality or novelty of proposed activity or project
Deliverables & Feasibility 40%
  • appropriateness of the methods and theoretical approach
  • probability that the objectives will be met within the timeline proposed
  • involvement of partners or stakeholders in the design and conduct of proposed activities
  • appropriateness of requested budget and justification of proposed costs
  • quality and appropriateness of any knowledge mobilization or commercialization plans
Potential Impact 35%
  • potential positive impact on the lives of older adults and caregivers
  • the associated benefits to older adults and caregivers is feasibly described
  • if applicable, quality of plan to sustain impact beyond AGE-WELL funding

AGE-WELL ECR Grant applications will be assigned a score for each of the three criteria above, based on the following scoring table. The appropriate weighting is then applied to arrive at a final score. Applications must receive a score of 6 or higher for each of the three criteria to be recommended for funding.

ScoreDescriptor
8-9 Very good to excellent
6-7 Good to very good
4-5 Satisfactory to good
Below 4 Unsatisfactory

Please direct any program or application questions to training@agewell-nce.ca.
